title: Lochcarron Walk Route

images.title: K  A / Ardaneaskan Museum
images.caption: Ardaneaskan Museum. The museum is the nearer of the two buildings and surely must be the smallest in the country. It contains items that that would be part of a crofter's everyday life. Loch Carron is in the mid distance and on the far shore is Creag an Duilisg

images.title: brian gillman, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ardaneaskan, Loch Carron, towards Plockton.

images.title: K  A / Ardaneaskan shoreline
images.caption: Ardaneaskan shoreline. The houses along Loch Carron's shore at Ardaneaskan. The picture is taken from the end of the public road. The peak on the far shore is Creag Mhaol, and the island is Strome Island where seals can normally be seen resting

images.title: sylvia duckworth / Tall trees near Leacanasigh.
images.caption: Tall trees near Leacanasigh.

images.title: sylvia duckworth / Steep corner at Leacanasigh.
images.caption: Steep corner at Leacanasigh.

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Castle Bay
images.caption: Castle Bay. Shoreline of Loch Carron immediately west of Strome Castle.

images.title: K  A / Strome Castle
images.caption: Strome Castle. The castle dates from the early years of the fifteenth century and survived intact for two hundred years or so. It was blown up by members of the Mckenzie Clan when they were in dispute with the rival Clan McDonald. It has been in a ruined condition ever since. It is seen here with Loch Carron stretching out behind it to the open sea, the Strome Islands are also visible

images.title: The Narrows of Strome by Glen Breaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Narrows of Strome

description: This walk takes you from Ardaneaskan to the ruins of Strome Castle on the shores of Lochcarron. From the lochside country lanes there are splendid views over the water to the surrounding woodland and mountains. The walk passes through Leacanashie before coming to Strome Castle. The ruins overlook the loch making it a great photo opportunity. You can virtually explore this section of the loch using the google street view link below!
